data.chText: 门窗
data.enText: at door/window

data.chText: 敲；击
data.enText: to hit a door, etc. firmly in order to attract attention

data.chText: 他敲了三下门就等着。
data.enText: He knocked three times and waited.

data.chText: 有人在敲窗户。
data.enText: Somebody was knocking on the window.

data.chText: 击
data.enText: hit

data.chText: （常为无意地）碰，撞
data.enText: to hit sth, often by accident, with a short, hard blow

data.chText: 小心，别把头撞在这矮梁上。
data.enText: Be careful you don't knock your head on this low beam.

data.chText: 她的手碰了玻璃杯。
data.enText: Her hand knocked against the glass.

data.chText: 把…撞击成（某种状态）
data.enText: to put sb/sth into a particular state by hitting them/it

data.chText: 那一拳把我打倒在地。
data.enText: The blow knocked me flat.

data.chText: 他被一拳打得不省人事。
data.enText: He was knocked senseless by the blow.

data.chText: 她把我的饮料打翻了。
data.enText: She knocked my drink flying.

data.chText: 那两间屋子打通了，成为一间屋。
data.enText: The two rooms had been knocked into one (= the wall between them had been knocked down) .

data.chText: 打掉；敲动；打破
data.enText: to hit sth so that it moves or breaks

data.chText: 他打翻了一杯水。
data.enText: He'd knocked over a glass of water.

data.chText: 我把钉子钉进墙里。
data.enText: I knocked the nail into the wall.

data.chText: 他们不得不破门而入。
data.enText: They had to knock the door down to get in.

data.chText: 男孩们在后院踢球玩儿。
data.enText: The boys were knocking (= kicking) a ball around in the back yard.

data.chText: 这一批评伤了她的自尊心。
data.enText: The criticism had knocked (= damaged) her self-esteem.

data.chText: 打，凿（洞）
data.enText: to make a hole in sth by hitting it hard

data.chText: 他们设法在墙上凿了个洞。
data.enText: They managed to knock a hole in the wall.

data.chText: 心；膝盖
data.enText: of heart/knees

data.chText: （心）怦怦跳；（膝盖）打哆嗦
data.enText: if your heart knocks , it beats hard; if your knees knock , they shake, for example from fear

data.chText: 我的心怦怦直跳。
data.enText: My heart was knocking wildly.

data.chText: 发动机；管子
data.enText: of engine/pipes

data.chText: （尤指因故障）发碰撞声，嘭嘭作响
data.enText: to make a regular sound of metal hitting metal, especially because there is sth wrong

data.chText: 批评
data.enText: criticize

data.chText: （不公平地）批评；贬责；挑剔；非难
data.enText: to criticize sb/sth, especially when it happens unfairly

data.chText: 报纸总是攻击英格兰队。
data.enText: The newspapers are always knocking the England team.

data.chText: “塑料？”“别说它不好——塑料的前景大着呢。”
data.enText: ‘Plastics?’ ‘ Don't knock it ─there's a great future in plastics.’
I'll knock your block/head off!

data.chText: （威胁要打人）我非揍你不可，我要揍扁你
data.enText: used to threaten sb that you will hit them
knock sb dead

data.chText: 使某人倾倒
data.enText: to impress sb very much

data.chText: 你看上去漂亮极了——今晚肯定把他们迷倒。
data.enText: You look fabulous─you'll knock 'em dead tonight.
knock sb/sth into a cocked hat

data.chText: 远远胜过某人（或事物）；大大超过；使相形见绌
data.enText: to be very much better than sb/sth
knock it off!

data.chText: 别吵了；别烦人了
data.enText: used to tell sb to stop making a noise, annoying you, etc.
knock sb off their pedestal/perch

data.chText: 使某人丧失名位
data.enText: to make sb lose their position as sb/sth successful or admired
knock sth on the head

data.chText: 阻止某事发生；停止做某事
data.enText: to stop sth from happening; to stop doing sth

data.chText: 经济衰退使扩展公司的任何想法都化为泡影。
data.enText: The recession knocked on the head any idea of expanding the company.
knock on wood
knock sb sideways

data.chText: 使某人惊讶得不知所措（或目瞪口呆）
data.enText: to surprise or shock sb so much that they are unable to react immediately
knock spots off sb/sth

data.chText: 远远胜过某人（事物）；大大超过；使相形见绌
data.enText: to be very much better than sb/sth
knock the stuffing out of sb

data.chText: 使某人丧失信心（或委靡不振）
data.enText: to make sb lose their confidence and enthusiasm
you could have knocked me down with a feather

data.chText: （表示惊奇）
data.enText: used to express surprise
beat/knock the (living) daylights out of sb

data.chText: 把某人狠揍一顿
data.enText: to hit sb very hard several times and hurt them very much
bang/knock your/their heads together

data.chText: 强行制止人们争吵并使之恢复理智
data.enText: to force people to stop arguing and behave in a sensible way
beat/kick (the) hell out of sb/sth
knock hell out of sb/sth

data.chText: 猛击；狠打
data.enText: to hit sb/sth very hard

data.chText: 他是个不讲体育道德的球员，喜欢猛力冲撞对方。
data.enText: He was a dirty player and loved to kick hell out of the opposition.
knock/talk some sense into sb

data.chText: 开导某人别干傻事；强使某人理智行事
data.enText: to try and persuade sb to stop behaving in a stupid way, sometimes using rough or violent methods
get/knock/lick sb into shape

data.chText: 把某人培养成材（或训练出来）
data.enText: to train sb so that they do a particular job, task, etc. well
hit/knock sb for six

data.chText: 极大地影响某人
data.enText: to affect sb very deeply
blow/knock sb's socks off

data.chText: 使某人万分惊愕；给某人留下深刻印象
data.enText: to surprise or impress sb very much
knock around…
knock about…

data.chText: 漫游
data.enText: to travel and live in various places

data.chText: 他花了几年时间漫游欧洲。
data.enText: He spent a few years knocking around Europe.

data.chText: （表示某物在一个地方但不知确切位置）
data.enText: used to say that sth is in a place but you do not know exactly where

data.chText: 它肯定在这儿某个地方。
data.enText: It must be knocking around here somewhere.
knock around with sb/together
knock about with sb/together

data.chText: 常与某人交往（或做伴）
data.enText: to spend a lot of time with sb/together
knock sb/sth around
knock sb/sth about

data.chText: 接连敲击某人（物）；粗暴对待
data.enText: to hit sb/sth repeatedly; to treat sb/sth roughly
knock sb back

data.chText: 阻碍，妨碍（某人取得成果或进步，尤指以回绝方式）
data.enText: to prevent sb from achieving sth or making progress, especially by rejecting them or sth that they suggest or ask

data.chText: 使某人大吃一惊（或感到惊讶）
data.enText: to surprise or shock sb

data.chText: 听到这消息着实让我大吃一惊。
data.enText: Hearing the news really knocked me back.
knock sb back sth

data.chText: 用掉某人一大笔钱
data.enText: to cost sb a lot of money

data.chText: 那房子一定花了他们不少钱。
data.enText: That house must have knocked them back a bit.
knock sth↔back

data.chText: 很快喝掉（酒等）
data.enText: to drink sth quickly, especially an alcoholic drink
knock sb down (from sth) (to sth)

data.chText: 说服…降价；使降价；杀价
data.enText: to persuade sb to reduce the price of sth

data.chText: 我设法让他把价格降到了400元。
data.enText: I managed to knock him down to $400.
knock sb↔down/over

data.chText: 打倒（或击倒、撞倒）某人
data.enText: to hit sb and make them fall to the ground

data.chText: 她被一辆公共汽车撞倒在地。
data.enText: She was knocked down by a bus.

data.chText: 他第一局就将对手击倒三次。
data.enText: He knocked his opponent down three times in the first round.
knock sth↔down

data.chText: 推倒（或拆掉、拆毁）建筑物
data.enText: to destroy a building by breaking its walls

data.chText: 这些旧房子要拆了。
data.enText: These old houses are going to be knocked down.
knock sth↔down (from sth) (to sth)

data.chText: 减价；降价
data.enText: to reduce the price of sth

data.chText: 他把价格从80元降到了50元。
data.enText: He knocked down the price from $80 to $50.
knock off
knock off sth

data.chText: 停止某事；中断某事；（尤指）下班，收工
data.enText: to stop doing sth, especially work

data.chText: 你今天想早点歇工吗？
data.enText: Do you want to knock off early today?

data.chText: 你什么时候下班？
data.enText: What time do you knock off work?

data.chText: 咱们收工吃午饭吧。
data.enText: Let's knock off for lunch.
knock sb↔off

data.chText: 杀死（或干掉、除掉、结果）某人
data.enText: to murder sb
knock sth↔off

data.chText: 迅速而轻松地完成
data.enText: to complete sth quickly and without much effort

data.chText: 他一年赶出三部小说。
data.enText: He knocks off three novels a year.

data.chText: 偷东西；抢劫某处
data.enText: to steal sth; to steal from a place

data.chText: 偷录像机
data.enText: to knock off a video recorder

data.chText: 抢劫银行
data.enText: to knock off a bank
knock sth↔off
knock sth↔off sth

data.chText: 降价；减价；使贬值
data.enText: to reduce the price or value of sth

data.chText: 因为有擦痕他们将价格降了60元。
data.enText: They knocked off $60 because of a scratch.

data.chText: 这消息使公司股价下跌13%。
data.enText: The news knocked 13% off the company's shares.
knock sb↔out

data.chText: 使入睡；使昏睡；使不省人事
data.enText: to make sb fall asleep or become unconscious

data.chText: 这一击把她打昏了。
data.enText: The blow knocked her out.

data.chText: 击败对手
data.enText: to hit an opponent so that they cannot get up within a limited time and therefore lose the fight

data.chText: 使大吃一惊；使倾倒；给某人留下深刻印象
data.enText: to surprise and impress sb very much

data.chText: 这电影着实令我赞叹不已。
data.enText: The movie just knocked me out.
knock sb/yourself out

data.chText: 使筋疲力尽；使疲惫不堪
data.enText: to make sb/yourself very tired
knock sb↔out (of sth)

data.chText: 把…淘汰出（比赛）
data.enText: to defeat sb so that they cannot continue competing

data.chText: 英格兰队已被淘汰出世界杯赛。
data.enText: England had been knocked out of the World Cup.
knock sth↔out

data.chText: 完成；快速而轻易地做成
data.enText: to produce sth, especially quickly and easily

data.chText: 他一年轻松写出五本书。
data.enText: He knocks out five books a year.
knock sb↔over
knock sth↔together

data.chText: 草草做成；匆匆拼凑成
data.enText: to make or complete sth quickly and often not very well

data.chText: 我用旧木板拼拼凑凑做了些书架。
data.enText: I knocked some bookshelves together from old planks.

data.chText: 把两间屋（或两座建筑物）打通
data.enText: to make two rooms or buildings into one by removing the wall between them

data.chText: 这房子是将两栋小屋的隔墙打通合二为一的。
data.enText: The house consists of two cottages knocked together.
knock up

data.chText: 赛前练习
data.enText: to practise for a short time before the start of a game
knock sb↔up

data.chText: 敲门唤醒某人
data.enText: to wake sb by knocking on their door

data.chText: 使怀孕
data.enText: to make a woman pregnant
knock sth↔up

data.chText: 迅速准备好；快速并轻易做成
data.enText: to prepare or make sth quickly and without much effort

data.chText: 她十分钟就做好了一顿饭。
data.enText: She knocked up a meal in ten minutes.

data.chText: 门窗
data.enText: at door/window

data.chText: 敲击声；敲门（或窗等）声
data.enText: the sound of sb hitting a door, window, etc. with their hand or with sth hard to attract attention

data.chText: 有敲门声。
data.enText: There was a knock on/at the door.

data.chText: 击
data.enText: hit

data.chText: 捶击；敲击；撞击
data.enText: a sharp blow from sth hard

data.chText: 他头部遭到重重一击。
data.enText: He got a nasty knock on the head.
take a (hard, nasty, etc.) knock

data.chText: 遭受（重大等）挫折；受到（沉重等）打击；受到（严重等）破坏
data.enText: to have an experience that makes sb/sth less confident or successful; to be damaged

data.text: hit ♦ knock ♦ bang ♦ strike ♦ bump ♦ bash

data.chText: 以上各词均含用力碰撞、撞击之义。
data.enText: All these words mean to come against sth with a lot of force.
hit

data.chText: 指碰撞、撞击，尤指造成损伤：
data.enText: to come against sth with force, especially causing damage or injury

data.chText: 男孩被超速行驶的汽车撞倒了。
data.enText: The boy was hit by a speeding car.
knock

data.chText: 指打掉、敲动、打破、撞成…：
data.enText: to hit sth so that it moves or breaks; to put sb/sth into a particular state or position by hitting them/it

data.chText: 有人在墙上打了个洞。
data.enText: Someone had knocked a hole in the wall.
bang

data.chText: 指大声地猛敲、砸：
data.enText: to hit sth in a way that makes a loud noise

data.chText: 小孩用调羹敲打着桌子。
data.enText: The baby was banging the table with his spoon.
strike

data.chText: 指猛烈地撞、碰、撞击、碰撞：
data.enText: ( formal ) to hit sb/sth hard

data.chText: 船触礁了。
data.enText: The ship struck a rock.
bump

data.chText: 指无意地碰、撞：
data.enText: to hit sb/sth accidentally

data.chText: 我在黑暗中撞上了一把椅子。
data.enText: In the darkness I bumped into a chair.
bash

data.chText: 指猛击、猛撞：
data.enText: ( informal ) to hit against sth very hard

data.chText: 我刹车太晚，撞上了前面的车。
data.enText: I braked too late, bashing into the car in front.
to hit/knock/bang/bump/bash against sb/sth
to knock/bang/bump/bash into sb/sth
to be hit/struck by a car/truck/bus
to hit/strike the ground/floor/wall

means: （尤指因故障）发碰撞声，嘭嘭作响

ex.chText: 谁先动手的?
ex.enText: Who struck the first blow?

ex.chText: 他用手杖打了那个男孩。
ex.enText: He struck the boy with his stick.

ex.chText: 音锤敲击钢琴琴弦并使之震动。
ex.enText: The hammers strike the piano strings and make them vibrate.

ex.chText: 海关大钟报时。
ex.enText: The huge clock at the Customs House strikes the hours.

synonyms.bx: 较正式用词，指迅速或突然地用力一击或敲击，可以是有意的，也可以是无意的。

ex.chText: 那可怜的孩子被打得青一块紫一块的。
ex.enText: The poor child was beaten black and blue.

ex.chText: 他们常被雇主打骂。
ex.enText: They were frequently cursed and beaten by the employer.

ex.chText: 杰克在游戏中战胜了乔布。
ex.enText: Jack beat Jobe to win the game.

ex.chText: 主队以大比分打败了客队。
ex.enText: The home team beat the visiting team by a large score.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指用手或器械连续击打，也指在游戏、竞赛或战争中战胜对手。

ex.chText: 导弹击中了航空母舰。
ex.enText: The missile hit the carrier.

ex.chText: 砖块击中了他的头部。
ex.enText: The brick hit him in the head.

ex.chText: 经济衰退使这家人遭到重创。
ex.enText: The economic recession hit the family hard.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指有目标地猛击，强调用力击中；引申指在精神、经济等方面予以打击。

ex.chText: 袭击者把她打倒在地并狠狠地踢她。
ex.enText: The attacker knocked her to the ground and kicked her hard.

ex.chText: 有人在敲门。
ex.enText: Somebody is knocking on the door.

ex.chText: 我希望你不要再敲桌子了。
ex.enText: I wish you wouldn't knock at the table again.

synonyms.bx: 指用拳头或器械猛敲、猛打，强调非常用力。

ex.chText: 他轻轻地拍了拍我的后背。
ex.enText: He tapped me on the back.

ex.chText: 她用手指敲打桌子。
ex.enText: She tapped the table with her fingers.

ex.chText: 他会心地拍了拍前额。
ex.enText: He tapped his forehead knowingly.

synonyms.bx: 指用手指等轻叩、轻拍或轻敲，意在引人注意，或表示爱抚等情感。

ex.chText: 进来前请先敲门。
ex.enText: Please knock before you enter.

ex.chText: 他不知道敲她的门是否恰当。
ex.enText: He wondered whether it would be proper to knock at her door.

ex.chText: 我听见他在壁炉架上磕打烟斗。
ex.enText: I heard him knock his pipe out on the mantelpiece.

synonyms.bx: 指用手掌、拳头或硬物用力敲打，以引起他人的注意或重视。

ex.chText: 主席敲桌子要求听众安静。
ex.enText: The chairman rapped on the table for order.

ex.chText: 她生气地敲他的窗户。
ex.enText: Angrily, she rapped on his window.

ex.chText: 他做数学题遇到困难时总是要敲书桌。
ex.enText: He would rap his fingers on the desk when he had difficulty working out a math problem.

synonyms.bx: 指用指关节、笔等快速轻敲或急拍，意在引人注意或表示某种情感。

data.enText: I'll knock your block/head off!

data.chText: （威胁要打人）我非揍你不可，我要揍扁你
data.enText: used to threaten sb that you will hit them
knock sb dead

data.chText: 使某人倾倒
data.enText: to impress sb very much

data.chText: 你看上去漂亮极了——今晚肯定把他们迷倒。
data.enText: You look fabulous─you'll knock 'em dead tonight.
knock sb/sth into a cocked hat

data.chText: 远远胜过某人（或事物）；大大超过；使相形见绌
data.enText: to be very much better than sb/sth
knock it off!

data.chText: 别吵了；别烦人了
data.enText: used to tell sb to stop making a noise, annoying you, etc.
knock sb off their pedestal/perch

data.chText: 使某人丧失名位
data.enText: to make sb lose their position as sb/sth successful or admired
knock sth on the head

data.chText: 阻止某事发生；停止做某事
data.enText: to stop sth from happening; to stop doing sth

data.chText: 经济衰退使扩展公司的任何想法都化为泡影。
data.enText: The recession knocked on the head any idea of expanding the company.
knock on wood
knock sb sideways

data.chText: 使某人惊讶得不知所措（或目瞪口呆）
data.enText: to surprise or shock sb so much that they are unable to react immediately
knock spots off sb/sth

data.chText: 远远胜过某人（事物）；大大超过；使相形见绌
data.enText: to be very much better than sb/sth
knock the stuffing out of sb

data.chText: 使某人丧失信心（或委靡不振）
data.enText: to make sb lose their confidence and enthusiasm
you could have knocked me down with a feather

data.chText: （表示惊奇）
data.enText: used to express surprise
beat/knock the (living) daylights out of sb

data.chText: 把某人狠揍一顿
data.enText: to hit sb very hard several times and hurt them very much
bang/knock your/their heads together

data.chText: 强行制止人们争吵并使之恢复理智
data.enText: to force people to stop arguing and behave in a sensible way
beat/kick (the) hell out of sb/sth
knock hell out of sb/sth

data.chText: 猛击；狠打
data.enText: to hit sb/sth very hard

data.chText: 他是个不讲体育道德的球员，喜欢猛力冲撞对方。
data.enText: He was a dirty player and loved to kick hell out of the opposition.
knock/talk some sense into sb

data.chText: 开导某人别干傻事；强使某人理智行事
data.enText: to try and persuade sb to stop behaving in a stupid way, sometimes using rough or violent methods
get/knock/lick sb into shape

data.chText: 把某人培养成材（或训练出来）
data.enText: to train sb so that they do a particular job, task, etc. well
hit/knock sb for six

data.chText: 极大地影响某人
data.enText: to affect sb very deeply
blow/knock sb's socks off

data.chText: 使某人万分惊愕；给某人留下深刻印象
data.enText: to surprise or impress sb very much
take a (hard, nasty, etc.) knock

data.chText: 遭受（重大等）挫折；受到（沉重等）打击；受到（严重等）破坏
data.enText: to have an experience that makes sb/sth less confident or successful; to be damaged
knock around…
knock about…

data.chText: 漫游
data.enText: to travel and live in various places

data.chText: 他花了几年时间漫游欧洲。
data.enText: He spent a few years knocking around Europe.

data.chText: （表示某物在一个地方但不知确切位置）
data.enText: used to say that sth is in a place but you do not know exactly where

data.chText: 它肯定在这儿某个地方。
data.enText: It must be knocking around here somewhere.
knock around with sb/together
knock about with sb/together

data.chText: 常与某人交往（或做伴）
data.enText: to spend a lot of time with sb/together
knock sb/sth around
knock sb/sth about

data.chText: 接连敲击某人（物）；粗暴对待
data.enText: to hit sb/sth repeatedly; to treat sb/sth roughly
knock sb back

data.chText: 阻碍，妨碍（某人取得成果或进步，尤指以回绝方式）
data.enText: to prevent sb from achieving sth or making progress, especially by rejecting them or sth that they suggest or ask

data.chText: 使某人大吃一惊（或感到惊讶）
data.enText: to surprise or shock sb

data.chText: 听到这消息着实让我大吃一惊。
data.enText: Hearing the news really knocked me back.
knock sb back sth

data.chText: 用掉某人一大笔钱
data.enText: to cost sb a lot of money

data.chText: 那房子一定花了他们不少钱。
data.enText: That house must have knocked them back a bit.
knock sth↔back

data.chText: 很快喝掉（酒等）
data.enText: to drink sth quickly, especially an alcoholic drink
knock sb down (from sth) (to sth)

data.chText: 说服…降价；使降价；杀价
data.enText: to persuade sb to reduce the price of sth

data.chText: 我设法让他把价格降到了400元。
data.enText: I managed to knock him down to $400.
knock sb↔down/over

data.chText: 打倒（或击倒、撞倒）某人
data.enText: to hit sb and make them fall to the ground

data.chText: 她被一辆公共汽车撞倒在地。
data.enText: She was knocked down by a bus.

data.chText: 他第一局就将对手击倒三次。
data.enText: He knocked his opponent down three times in the first round.
knock sth↔down

data.chText: 推倒（或拆掉、拆毁）建筑物
data.enText: to destroy a building by breaking its walls

data.chText: 这些旧房子要拆了。
data.enText: These old houses are going to be knocked down.
knock sth↔down (from sth) (to sth)

data.chText: 减价；降价
data.enText: to reduce the price of sth

data.chText: 他把价格从80元降到了50元。
data.enText: He knocked down the price from $80 to $50.
knock off
knock off sth

data.chText: 停止某事；中断某事；（尤指）下班，收工
data.enText: to stop doing sth, especially work

data.chText: 你今天想早点歇工吗？
data.enText: Do you want to knock off early today?

data.chText: 你什么时候下班？
data.enText: What time do you knock off work?

data.chText: 咱们收工吃午饭吧。
data.enText: Let's knock off for lunch.
knock sb↔off

data.chText: 杀死（或干掉、除掉、结果）某人
data.enText: to murder sb
knock sth↔off

data.chText: 迅速而轻松地完成
data.enText: to complete sth quickly and without much effort

data.chText: 他一年赶出三部小说。
data.enText: He knocks off three novels a year.

data.chText: 偷东西；抢劫某处
data.enText: to steal sth; to steal from a place

data.chText: 偷录像机
data.enText: to knock off a video recorder

data.chText: 抢劫银行
data.enText: to knock off a bank
knock sth↔off
knock sth↔off sth

data.chText: 降价；减价；使贬值
data.enText: to reduce the price or value of sth

data.chText: 因为有擦痕他们将价格降了60元。
data.enText: They knocked off $60 because of a scratch.

data.chText: 这消息使公司股价下跌13%。
data.enText: The news knocked 13% off the company's shares.
knock sb↔out

data.chText: 使入睡；使昏睡；使不省人事
data.enText: to make sb fall asleep or become unconscious

data.chText: 这一击把她打昏了。
data.enText: The blow knocked her out.

data.chText: 击败对手
data.enText: to hit an opponent so that they cannot get up within a limited time and therefore lose the fight

data.chText: 使大吃一惊；使倾倒；给某人留下深刻印象
data.enText: to surprise and impress sb very much

data.chText: 这电影着实令我赞叹不已。
data.enText: The movie just knocked me out.
knock sb/yourself out

data.chText: 使筋疲力尽；使疲惫不堪
data.enText: to make sb/yourself very tired
knock sb↔out (of sth)

data.chText: 把…淘汰出（比赛）
data.enText: to defeat sb so that they cannot continue competing

data.chText: 英格兰队已被淘汰出世界杯赛。
data.enText: England had been knocked out of the World Cup.
knock sth↔out

data.chText: 完成；快速而轻易地做成
data.enText: to produce sth, especially quickly and easily

data.chText: 他一年轻松写出五本书。
data.enText: He knocks out five books a year.
knock sb↔over
knock sth↔together

data.chText: 草草做成；匆匆拼凑成
data.enText: to make or complete sth quickly and often not very well

data.chText: 我用旧木板拼拼凑凑做了些书架。
data.enText: I knocked some bookshelves together from old planks.

data.chText: 把两间屋（或两座建筑物）打通
data.enText: to make two rooms or buildings into one by removing the wall between them

data.chText: 这房子是将两栋小屋的隔墙打通合二为一的。
data.enText: The house consists of two cottages knocked together.
knock up

data.chText: 赛前练习
data.enText: to practise for a short time before the start of a game
knock sb↔up

data.chText: 敲门唤醒某人
data.enText: to wake sb by knocking on their door

data.chText: 使怀孕
data.enText: to make a woman pregnant
knock sth↔up

data.chText: 迅速准备好；快速并轻易做成
data.enText: to prepare or make sth quickly and without much effort

data.chText: 她十分钟就做好了一顿饭。
data.enText: She knocked up a meal in ten minutes.

example: he gave the table a whack

tr: the sound of knocking (as on a door or in an engine or bearing)

example: he took a bash right in his face
he got a bang on the head

tr: point out real or perceived flaws
example: The paper criticized the new movie

tr: deliver a sharp blow or push :"He knocked the glass clear across the room"
knock against with force or violence
example: My car bumped into the tree

tr: sound like a car engine that is firing too early
example: the car pinged when I put in low-octane gasoline
The car pinked when the ignition was too far retarded

tr: make light, repeated taps on a surface
example: he was tapping his fingers on the table impatiently

value.def: If you knock on something such as a door or window, you hit it, usually several times, to attract someone's attention.

example.ex: She went directly to Simon's apartment and knocked on the door...
example.tran: 她直奔西蒙的房间，敲了敲门。

example.ex: Knock at my window at eight o'clock and I'll be ready...
example.tran: 8点钟敲我的窗，我会准备好的。

example.ex: He knocked before going in.
example.tran: 他进去前先敲了敲门。

example.ex: They heard a knock at the front door.
example.tran: 他们听到前门有人敲门。

example.ex: They were wakened by a loud knocking at the door.
example.tran: 他们被一阵嘈杂的敲门声吵醒。

value.def: If you knock something, you touch or hit it roughly, especially so that it falls or moves.

example.ex: She accidentally knocked the tea tin off the shelf...
example.tran: 她不小心把架子上的茶叶罐碰了下来。

example.ex: The baby was knocked from his father's arms...
example.tran: 婴儿被从他父亲的怀中撞落。

example.ex: Isabel rose so abruptly that she knocked down her chair...
example.tran: 伊莎贝尔起得太急了，以致碰倒了她坐的椅子。

example.ex: Buckets of roses had been knocked over.
example.tran: 一桶桶的玫瑰被撞翻在地。

example.ex: The bags have tough exterior materials to protect against knocks, rain and dust.
example.tran: 这些包的面料非常结实耐用，可以防撞、防雨并防尘。

value.tran: 碰，撞；（尤指）碰倒，撞倒，敲动

value.def: If someone knocks two rooms or buildings into one, or knocks them together, they make them form one room or building by removing a wall.

example.ex: They decided to knock the two rooms into one...
example.tran: 他们决定把两间屋子打通连成一间。

example.ex: The spacious kitchen was achieved by knocking together three small rooms.
example.tran: 这个宽敞的厨房是由3个小屋子打通连成的。

value.def: To knock someone into a particular position or condition means to hit them very hard so that they fall over or become unconscious.

example.ex: The third wave was so strong it knocked me backwards...
example.tran: 第3波浪太大了，把我打了回去。

example.ex: They were knocked to the ground and robbed of their wallets...
example.tran: 他们被打倒在地并被抢走了钱包。

example.ex: Someone had knocked him unconscious.
example.tran: 有人把他打昏了。

value.tran: 把…撞击到（某个位置）；把…打成（某种状态）

value.def: To knock a particular quality or characteristic out of someone means to make them lose it.

example.ex: The stories of his links with the actress had knocked the fun out of him...
example.tran: 有关他与那位女演员有关系的传闻使他很不开心。

example.ex: When they first joined for training many were starry eyed about just sailing around the world. We soon knocked that out of them...
example.tran: 在他们参加培训之初，很多人还只是对环球航行抱有天真的想法。我们很快便使他们消除了那种想法。

example.ex: Those people hurt me and knocked my confidence.
example.tran: 那些人既伤害了我的身体又打击了我的自信心。

value.tran: 使失去（某种品质或特征）

value.def: If something knocks, it makes a repeated sharp banging noise.

example.ex: His old truck, knocking and smoking, pulled down the road and out of sight.
example.tran: 他那辆旧卡车一边冒着烟一边哐里哐啷地沿路向前驶去，直到驶出了视线。

value.def: If you knock something or someone, you criticize them and say unpleasant things about them.

example.ex: I'm not knocking them: if they want to do it, it's up to them...
example.tran: 我不是批评他们：想不想做那件事取决于他们。

example.ex: Never knock charter flights; they are opening up the world for budget-conscious travellers.
example.tran: 绝不要挑剔包机航班；他们使精打细算的乘客能够去往世界各地。

example.ex: This season he's more determined than ever to prove the knockers wrong.
example.tran: 这个赛季他比以往任何时候都更坚决地想要证明那些批评者是错的。

value.def: If someone receives a knock, they have an unpleasant experience which prevents them from achieving something or which causes them to change their attitudes or plans.

example.ex: What they said was a real knock to my self-confidence...
example.tran: 他们的话是对我自信心的一次重大打击。

example.ex: The art market has suffered some severe knocks during the past two years.
example.tran: 在过去的两年间，艺术品市场遭受了严重的打击。

value.def: To knock them dead means to impress people a great deal, especially with your appearance.

example.ex: Glamorous make-up is best reserved for days when you want to go all out to knock  'em dead.
example.tran: 魅惑彩妆最好留到你竭力想把所有人都迷倒的时候。

value.tran: （尤指以相貌）给…留下深刻印象，使…倾倒

value.def: If you tell someone to knock it off, you are telling them to stop doing something that is annoying you.

example.ex: Will you just knock it off!
example.tran: 别闹了！

xrse.def: to knock something on the head
to knock someone or something into shape

trans: （被车）撞倒；推倒，拆掉，拆毁（建筑物）；降（价）；杀（价）；减（量）
